chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:58 AM . Defendant James D. Kivlin in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for James D. Kivlin.  Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances, states history of all 4 cases, noting she's been provided a written waiver of prelim in 22CF323 and 22CF344.  DE and Atty Frank agree they will waive the PH today.  Court questions DE on waiver/accepts/finds probable cause/binds DE over in 22CF323 and 22CF344.  Time limits for prelim cont'd waived in 22CF543 and Atty Frank would like a chance to discuss all 4 matters w/the DA's office.  All matters to track.
Return date scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Arraignment scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:24 PM Prosecuting attorney Emily Eklund and Intern, Dan Moon, in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James D. Kivlin in court.  Atty Dolch is present with DE.  DE qualifies for PD representation.  Atty Dolch recommends a preliminary hearing.  Matter reset.  Bond continues.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:19 PM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James D. Kivlin in court. Reset
Return date scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on August 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

2:40 Prosecuting attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James D. Kivlin appeared by video, in custody from LEC with atty. Hayes . Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney. State requests cash bond w/conditions and sites warrant history.  Atty. Hayes makes argument for signature bond. Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $150.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact w/M.S.R.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Return date scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on July 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 1, 2022 at 09:15 am.
